column2: "Munchkin is a wonderful game for the card loving role playing game enthusiast. It is a great game in that there are an infinite combination in the cards making every game more unique with every expansion that you add to it. I would recommend unnatural axe to you."

"My daughter received this in her easter basket (at 16 months old).  She gets such a kick out of this duck.  At first she found it absolutly hysterical that when she pulled the string it follows her.  She loves pulling it around the house and its very sturdy and doesn't tip over all the time.  We have carpeting and hardwood floors and it works fine on both.  She has even taken it outside and it works well there too (on the sidewalk).  We have had this toy for over 2 months and my daughter enjoys it immensely.  I highly recommend it.  It's one of her favorite toys that she uses daily."
"Took me over 2 hours to assemble this toy...had to keep shooing my kid to the next room so she won't walk away with any of the pieces...Like everyone else who dislike the assembling part
column3: I was quite disappointed to see a bunch of plastic pieces stuck together in "clusters" that I had to physically cut apart b4 attempting to assemble...this took FOREVER
column4: not to mention finding the right piece that matches the instruction AND making sure after it's cut out that it doesn't get lost!!why couldn't the manufacturer put the modules together into larger
column5: assembled pieces and all parents have to do is put together those modules (ie fridge
column6: stove
column7: microwave etc) onto the frame itself? Why make it so difficult for us to have to start "from scratch" in cutting out EACH INDIVIDUAL plastic piece from various clusters? And what I find even more terrible is that we have to also put those stickers that indicate where the switches are on the dish washer
column8: microwave etc...can't they put that together b4 shipping it out?If it weren't for the price I would not have gotten this item. But even so
column9: the saving is not enough to justify the time it takes to assemble this thing
column10: especially when you have a kid waiting impatiently to play w/ it...I jammed several fingers w/ the screw driver as I was trying to keep my kid happy and assemble this thing at the same time..."

column2: "was surprised to get the new figures instead of the original
column3: colorful
column4: chunkier people.  think our son may have liked them better. the new designed people are ok but the original were more colorful and looked like they were going on vacation - more to talk to your child with and pretend.  the new girl looks shy and is ok
column5: the boy is athletic
column6: and the pilot does not look like a pilot. when you have a special needs child - you want to have things to point out and talk about. he is not interested in them and only plays with the plane. not a real problem but just a heads up for those buying this plane."

column2: "This adorable little coffee maker is just the right size for my daughter's play kitchen. Very durable and cute!! Only gripe (reason for 4 stars)

column4: or happen
column5: maybe some type of sound. She loves the coffee maker and totally uses her imagination when making coffee for daddy in the morning. Over all
column6: wonderful coffee maker (would recommend!)and found all Educo products to be great
column7: so far."

column2: "We got this for our 10-year-old daughter who loves to play football at school. They like the nerf-type footballs and this one fits the bill perfectly. Good size for her hands and the other kids enjoy it
column3: too. The strip around it makes it very unique and that's cool. Before it got really cold we played with it outside in dusk and it was a lot of fun. Easy to throw and catch. Plus
column4: it's held up very well
column5: even after being dropped - or thrown - onto the driveway several times! Highly recommend for younger ones especially."

column2: "We played it with our daughter when she was the same age as our grandson who is seven years old.We all had fun now as we did then."

"My son got this tool set as a gift for his 2nd birthday. It has been his favorite since the day he got it. He is now 3 years old and it still remains one of his favorites. I was looking into getting the bench also so that he can have it more elevated. He even takes the tools with him to help my husband with household projects."
"my great-grandsons really enjoyed this tunnel. they raced one another through and through for a long time
column3: laughing a lot. it's very easy to tie back together having velcro grips. it also connects easily to other tunnels."

column2: "The Tonka Chuck & Friends Flip the Bounce Back Racer is okay for three- to six-year-olds but older children get bored quickly.  With two cars they could race them
column3: but with one car
column4: the fun is limited to bumping into things and chasing each other going backwards & forwards
column5: either inside or on a hard surface outdoors
column6: as there is no steering mechanism.It will run up a slope with enough speed and
column7: with some practice
column9: at least sometimes.  The car also speaks enthusiastically and the little ones loved that although I found it annoying after just a few minutes.The car and remote together take a total of eight AA batteries (which I was surprised to find are NOT included) so I suggest rechargeableeneloops.Overall
column10: it is reasonably well-made for a plastic toy."

column2: "I got this for my daughter at 10 months for Christmas.  She loved it then and still loves it
column3: and she is 16 months old.  I like that she can stack the blocks
column4: shake the blocks
column5: and also pull the alligator behind her.  She likes the music and rolling the eyes of the alligator too.  I am not as crazy about the music
column6: but it does play "it's raining it's pouring" and I think a couple of other songs.  She likes to also turn the alligator over and push the button on the bottom (little black button that is more apparent when the pull part is up)that turns off the current music and makes a strange wood block sound (sorry that is all I can compare it to).  So I hear a lot of noises on a daily basis from that thing.  She liked it a lot initially because she was into pushing cars around and now that she is older is is fun for her to have it trail after her.  She plays with it at least some way (playing with the blocks or pulling the 'gator) at least once a day.  I would suggest this to someone if their child is into pushing cars around on the floor or likes stacking blocks things on each other(of course they should be in the age group that this is intended).  It isn't for all children of course
column7: but I realized what my child like doing and this was what I picked.  I definitely appreciate my choice
column8: the only thing else I would like to note is that after over 8 months is that I have only changed the batteries once.  Which is not to bad in my book."

column2: "We love our Schleich animals. Our only complaint about the crocodile is that he's a little bigger than he "should" be in comparison to the other animals. This is true for a few (most are to scale with other animals)
column3: but it really stands out with the croc. Otherwise
column4: great details and color."

column2: "I hate when Mattel or Disney go cheap on these dolls and they are made with a hard plastic leg that doesn't bend

column2: "My son loves backhoes and this one is very realistic looking. It is metal but isn't all that heavy. I'm impressed"
"My daughter loves things with slides
column3: so this was right up her alley. Overall
column4: this was a huge pain to assemble! It comes in tiny pieces that all snap together
column5: and it is very easy to get frustrated. The top two platforms aren't very secure and slide out when you move the castle. It took me about 30 minutes to fully assemble

It's very cute and my daughter was highly entertained.The bottom platform also spins by using a small scissor like handle. It comes with a small bed and some dishes. Warning - the dishes are VERY small and are easily a choking hazard. This is definitely not for young toddlers and those that need supervision!"

column2: "My daughter asked for this for my grandson for Christmas. It is a really cute toy and he loves it

column2: "Every child should have this toy!!!  My kids outgrew this toy a long time ago (they are 5 and & now) and I always remembered it as one of the most played with toys when they were young.  It was one of my favorites.This thing lasted threw 2 toddlers
column3: it has been dropped
column4: kicked and thrown and it still worked until the day I gave it away to another child.  My kids would take it off of the fridge and carry it around like a boom box.  They both loved the song and I thought it was cute.HIGHLY recommend this toy.  My nephew will be one in August and I assure I will be giving him this toy for his first birthday."

column2: "About a year ago I helped out at my Sunday school church in the third thru fifth grade class rooms and noticed a small crowd of mostly boys playing with this toy. They were pretty quiet as they were concentrating & working together to build a huge tower. I thought the toy looked interesting enough that I purchased it for my then 4 yr old boy that Christmas. Not only does he love to play with it
column3: but I was really surprised that my 2 and a half year old boy loved it as well and was not too young to play with it. I had purchased the 230 piece set. Now
column4: this Christmas coming up
column5: I will give them the 400 piece set. This will enable them to build larger things. I absolutely recommend this toy. Children will play with it for many years before outgrowing it. We have some damage to several of the straws only because our kitten chewed on them. Plan on buying a plastic tub to keep the pieces in
column6: as the box it comes in is pretty cheap. Great toy for creating 3D cages the kids can climb into
column7: cubes
column8: and towers that can block off entire doorways. After almost a full year
column9: my boys still love this toy."

column2: "I got this for my son's first Christmas
column3: which was a mistake.  He was too young but the older kids loved it.  One of the older kids loved it too much and discovered that the mallet
column4: which has very square corners
column5: could be used to make delightful dents in drywall.  And then in the process of the wreckertons playing with it
column6: one of the wooden ramps inside came out (we could have glued it back in promptly and it would have been fine
column7: but then it disappeared
column8: as toys do) and the yellow ball went AWOL.  So now we are missing a ball and a ramp.  I put the toy away for a while
column9: got it out again a few months ago - baby was 20 or 21 months old.It's a GREAT toy.  I'd say ideal for 18m and up.  It takes just enough resistance to pound the balls through the holes that it is the right balance between challenging and rewarding.  It makes a nice clackity sound as the ball rolls through - even minus a ramp.  Simple means of teaching colors and numbers 1-4 to a very young child.  Just plain fun for a little one.My daughter seems to have outgrown her hunger for destroying drywall so that's good.  We haven't lost any more ramps so just that one must have been loose - it's totally and easily fixable if you have this issue
column10: you just need to do it before you lose it."

column2: "A great game that can be played by itself.  This is not an expansion and does not need the original Dominion but having all of the games/expansions is far more enjoyable than just owning one."

"These tattoos are a great price and they are already individually separated which is helpful.  I really like the designs - perfect for little kids.  The tattoo was easy to apply.  I used the ladybug and my toddler was pretty excited about it.  I did give her a bath later in the day
column3: and the next day the tattoo was faded.  However
column4: it was faded and not missing pieces unlike what has happened with some other temporary tattoos."

We used it around the drink table and around some boxes and then we used most of it for across some beams at the picnic shelter.  It worked very well!  It isn't paper

column2: "I'm very thankful for the previous reviews as this led us to purchase this item.It is AWESOME!  We added it to the Thomas Water Tower Figure 8 set. The bridge on that set kept coming apart & so we decided to add this & am so glad we did!Not only do the wooden Thomas trains fit on this so do some miscellaneous mini cars.  We had some Tonka cars we bought from KOHL's & they fit perfectly (NOTE: on Amazon I'm pretty sure this is the item in case you want to buy them as they are really cute & fun for toddlers: Tonka: Chuck and Friends Train Fleet).  So they can play w/ both the trains & the cars.  Not all cars will
column3: but some do.This has been very educational.  They learn to put the track together & that for the trains to zoom out the door they have to have them @ the top & let go.  They can have multiple trains together too.  As other reviewers have noted
column4: toddlers for some reason want to put things in upward/backwards through the door.  I think this is just a learning phase which is neat to watch.  They are figuring it out. So far
column5: we haven't had anything get stuck or anything & hopefully won't in the future.I am so glad I purchased this & it is our favorite piece we've bought so far for the Thomas tracks."

column2: "There isn't enough of the sticky stuff to use on all the stars. They don't seem to glow for very long."

"I bought this for my 4-year-old grandson who loves floor puzzles.  First of all he was delighted with the shape of the box.  Then he tore into the puzzle and had it done in about 15-20 minutes.  He has redone it at least 5 or 6 times since.  I am trying to get him to share it with his pre-K class but he declines - afraid they won't give it back!  It is really a lot of fun as the pieces are big and the picture is not too complicated."
"My 4-year-old grandson is addicted to all things superhero
column3: and one of his favorite heroes is Spiderman. This plastic plane was an instant hit -- and best of all
column4: it required NO batteries as it has no electronics (which is getting rare in toys these days). The plane is the perfect size for him to "fly" while running around the house and the clear plastic canopy lifts up to put Spiderman inside the cockpit. The figure lays down on its back in the plane and is larger than usual in size making it easy for little fingers to grip.The two shooting "projectiles" provided a lot of enthusiasm -- they click into each front wing and when the button is pressed
column5: the two soft plastic pieces are shot from the plane fairly gently and without a lot of velocity from their ports. He loved it --  and there's not much chance of those plastic projectiles hurting anyone or causing damage. In addition
column6: when you squeeze its legs
column7: Spiderman's hand shoots out mimicking a web strike. We were able to imagine lots of dangerous missions for hours of fun.This toy looks very durable and I love that it makes no noise! I'm sure he will enjoy it for a long time. I did notice his little brother (age 1) had his eye on it too!"

column2: "I have to admit I had not seen any of these little guys before.  Upon first appearance they look soft and cuddly and they are to a point

column4: cute feature. I'm sure children will love them as well. The only problem  with the song was that you have to keep pushing to hear the song. A smaller child may never get through it. The song was very clear however.  The chatter was just that chatter
column5: but I assume a child would giggle at it. I think this is different and children like different. It certainly seems that it would entertain a little one and  keep them entertained."

column2: "I was seriously impressed with the value in this cute "little" toy. It doesn't look like much until you see it up close and personal. The quality of the set is excellent. It doesn't feel like the cheap plastic stuff you tend to find in stores these days. This also brought back childhood memories of the Little People Treehouse from the 70s for me. Play value is excellent. My 10 year old absolutely loved everything about the cute little dolls with button eyes and the neat stitch-work look of the trees. The little elevator
column3: donut swing
column4: etc. will keep your child entertained. The detail in the play-set looks like it's been sewn together giving you the idea of a home-made toy. It's not as small as it looks either. You get quite a bargain in the parts/accessories that come within the set. It is by no means chintzy. Best of all
column5: we didn't have the hassle of crazy assembly. Hands down
column6: this will be an excellent gift for any child ages 5 & up that are interested in the Lalaloopsy dolls."

column2: "My grandson loves this castle and plays with it for hours on end. And when he's not playing with it

column2: "This is the sweetest doll I've seen in a long time. She is a combination of the traditional
column3: huggable baby doll and technology. There are 150+ actions
column4: sounds & phrases. She actually responds to touch. She's a great way to distract "mommy" out of a cranky mood. It's hard to be cranky when this doll says all those loving phrases and needs attention.The electronics make it difficult to dress and undress her. They also make her a little 'hard' and less huggable.She has an adorable voice and a sweet disposition. How can a doll have a sweet disposition? The things she says and does. "I love you
column5: bear! You're the best bear in the whole world!" (and she kisses the bear with a loud kissing noise)
column6: and "I love you THIS much (and her arms go out to show you how much she loves you." Nice eye lashes!She works on magnets and 4 AA batteries
column7: batteries included. One plus for me is the fact that she doesn't seem to "require" more accessories. I went to their web site at littlemommy.com and there are plenty of accessories
column8: but the doll does fine without them. If you want to buy the stroller
column17: but definitely not necessary. This doll comes with enough accessories to keep a child busy and happy. I would suggest counting the accessories and having a special storage place for them at the end of the day. Otherwise you will be pulling long searches for a spoon or Bandaid
column18: because your child won't want to be without them.Positives: This is such an adorable doll!Negatives: There are none. I love her already.Make sure not to lose the bear
column22: band aid (which looks like a plastic bracelet)
column24: and spoon. I would advise open the box very carefully
column25: from the back side of the box
column26: as designed. That makes things much easier to clip and remove.EDITED after 2 days of listening to her constant chatter. The adults were all joking about her maniacal laugh. Lots of jokes about wasn't she the doll in the horror movie
column28: but the children ignored the jokes and kept running to feed her and fix her 'owee' and give her bear to her whenever she talked. SHE HAS AN ON-OFF SWITCH and we did use it.  :)"

column2: "We have been waiting for green toys to make a plane! My 3 year old is thrilled with it and wants to bring it everywhere"
"I had reservations on this toy
column3: but am happy I bought it b/c it is really fun! It is like an update to the old favorite Transformers. Transformers are still loved; however
column4: I do like that these have sound. And
column5: the switch back & forth between the vehicle & the dinosaur is EXTREMELY easy which is appreciated so little one's can enjoy this too. The quality is excellent. The wheels on the car roll really smoothly & each part clicks/pops/changes into it's spot really easily. I first bought the blue Triceratops so far
column6: but after seeing how much fun & enjoyment this is bringing I bought the other's as well & am just as happy w/ them. It is good to have several of them to "race".  If you do have any of the Transformers
column7: these change back & forth very similarly; however
column8: I did notice a big difference in the ease of doing so. And
column9: these stay in their positions better. By that I mean if you click to a car then it is solidly the car & vice versa. Whereas
column11: we have a hard time getting them to stay in either postion. The head would pop-up/etc. These VTech Switch & Go Dinos are wonderful. I highly recommend & have bought all 4 offered. Price is in line w/ the quality & fun of the toy. Pleasant surprise. I'm not an expert
column12: but I think this would be a good toy for 2 1/2 & older. If given younger
column13: they will need help & you do need to watch they don't get their fingers pinched
column14: but as they grow into them they will be able to do on their own & have a blast. It is fun to see them race these & I know I noted it above already
column15: but I was very happy about how smooth the wheels roll. That seems like an odd thing to point out
column16: but it is appreciated when car toys roll really well & don't make sounds/seem to get stuck or don't roll smoothly - so hard to put into words
column17: but I think you'll know what I mean when you roll this - just really smooth. The actual toy itself does make really cool racing sounds though while in the car position & the Triceratops makes cool growling/etc noises. Great toy for BOTH boys & girls who enjoy cars

column2: "Germany delivers again with a very enjoyable--yet highly strategic--board game. Assorted (and finely detailed!) tiles about 40 in number can be drawn by two to five players from a box. The player then connects the tile to the main board
column3: where the depictions of grass
column4: castle and road drawings must correspond to other adjacent tiles. Once a tile is placed
column5: the player may place a piece on the board
column6: and these men help the player garnish points through completing streets
column7: castles
column8: monasteries or fields. The fun of the game involves the luck of the draw and the strategy of whether to build up your creations or make it difficult for the other participating players.My wife and I laid the foundation for our relationship while playing this game during our courtship
column9: and we continue to play in our marriage. We rate Carcassonne among the board game titans of Settlers of Catan and Scrabble."

column2: "Great helicopter! After a couple of weeks of fun with the Syma S107/S107G R/C Helicopter. I did some modifications to improve its performance. Please see my review and pictures on the: Syma S107 / S107G Upgrade 3.7V Lithium Polymer 240 mah Battery for Remote Control Helicopter Helizone RC FirebirdSyma S107 / S107G Upgrade 3.7V Lithium Polymer 240 mah Battery for Remote Control Helicopter Helizone RC FirebirdThe first modification I made was I added a smaller 70mAh battery with the stock 150mAh battery. I placed the 70mAh battery under the belly directly under the main rotor shaft. This did extend the flight time and made the helicopter very stable and even easier to fly.  I splice and solder the 70mAh battery with the stock battery. See pics to see both batteries installed. I did this as a temporary modification until I did the upgrade with 3.7V Lithium Polymer 240 mah Battery. Once the 240 mah Battery came in
column3: I'd installed it and removed both 70mah and stock 150mah batteries. Then I notice better speed and performance. Great helicopter to fly."

column2: "Each Barbie movie these days spawns a toy store aisle worth of tie-ins
column3: withBarbie in the Pink Shoesbeing the newest.  In many of the Barbies over the last few years this was often typified by replacing doll and costume quality with gimmickry
column4: and I'm happy to see the Pink Shoes collection is much better made.This transforming Kristyn doll uses a clever mechanic to reverse the skirt from purple-blue Odette/Giselle-inspired storyline skirt to the full pink Barbie-esque one that Kristyn wears at the end.  I had concerns about whether the doll would survive my overly-enthusiastic 6yo and 3yo
column5: but they've had her for a couple months of regular play and she's still fine (a serious accomplishment
column6: actually).While they did pose Kristyn's hands and feet in ballet pose
column7: they made her knees straight.  I thought that strange since both theGiselleandOdettedolls have bendable knees that
column9: cause them to entrechat like Kristyn does in the movie.  You'll also notice from those two dolls that this "transforming" Kristyn doesn't really look like either of them when changed.  Fortunately kids at that age are full of imagination
column10: and that sort of petty detail is solidly in the realm of grown-up gripe.For my girls
column11: Barbie's transformation and the fun they have acting out scenes fromthe movieis as magical as the source stories.  Well done

column15: draining the batteries.- The Bad: well
column16: if you're looking for professional quality pictures
column17: you'll be disappointed. My son doesn't care about this. If you do
column19: the camera makes noises when buttons are pressed
column20: and (as far as I know) you can't turn these off
column21: so you may not want to have Junior play with this during a wedding or something. Finally - really
column23: you couldn't have thrown in a cheapie USB cable? Shame.All in all
column24: this is a fun toy and a great way to get your child interested in taking pictures. Despite some reservations on my part
column25: it's sure to be a hit with younger children
column26: especially ones who have shown an interest in using your camera."

column2: "Wonderful mess free color markers for children of all ages.  Younger children are able to color because the markers do not color on anything except the special paper--not on clothes
column3: kids
column4: furniture or walls.  Perfect for travelling and anytime something is needed to entertain young children."

column2: "My son loves this "fire smasher" - he calls it.  I don't like it becuase I feel each disc should make a different sound - they all make the same noise. But my son doesn't notice and really likes it. A friend brought over a sword and the two seem compatible (they fit together). Didn't know that so that was a fun surprise if you're in the market for two toys. Decent quality and I don't think I paid that much for it. So good buy
column3: I suppose."

column2: "Leapster is a wonderful
column3: durable and entertaining product for young children. The finding Nemo cartridge has kept my 5 year old grand daughter captivated
column4: entertained for hours. While many of the cardridges are very learning skills focused
column5: this catridge emophasizes fun
column6: humor and helping others. Battery life is excellent even when played for hours at a time. The unit survives the beating of a two year old sister without a hitch. The game and cartridge are well suited for a five year old."

column2: "My grandson loves it. I thought it looked bigger in the picture

column2: "My granddaughter loves anything puppy so this will be perfect for her.  It is very well made and I really love it.  I was surprised at how tiny it is though.  Guess I didn't check the measurements and for the price I couldn't expect much more."
"This is a Great gift for any 1-5 year old. It is a little advanced for a one year old

column3: seems to flow better. I think it has helped my daughter stand faster and longer because she was so interested in it."

column2: "I am a puzzle maniac
column3: having assembled jigsaw puzzles from 100 to 9000 pieces (a 13200 pieces is in the queue and I am really going to the 18
column5: 000 pieces from Ravensburger in the future...). Some of them were 3D puzzles
column6: like the Taj Mahal
column7: US Capitol
column10: etc. This one in particular is a very high quality product from Ravensburger (as usual)
column11: all the pieces have an excellent finishing and they stick together very well. I usually assemble this size of puzzles in Foam Boards. They are very light and conveniently cheap. The foam board being 3/16'' (5mm) gives your puzzle enough support. I usually cut the board (easily done with a cutter) after glueing the puzzle
column12: leaving a border of 1'' at each side
column13: so I can pin the board in my garage (that
column15: is full of puzzles...). For puzzles 5
column16: 000 pieces and larger I usually go with a 4'x8'x5/32'' plywood that I pre-cut at the size of the puzzle plus 1 inch extra on each side... This is heavier and a little more expensive
column17: but gives better support and for that size of puzzle I need that extra support. You might be able to accommodate up to a 6
column18: 000 piece in one of those 4'x 8' (feet) boards. So far I have assembled 2 x 5
column26: 000 and smaller. What help me a lot is that my wife and daughters also like the challenge
column28: 000 piece puzzle do not last a weekend
column30: 000 piece one took us 2 months (most 2 to 3 hours at night work) to put together. This one in particular took us 5 days to put together
column31: as it has a good amount of sky and the reflections are never easy. I highly recommend Ravensburger products for the excellent quality to everyone that enjoys challenges alone or with the whole family. It is a guaranteed entertainment for hours
column32: listening to music or talking in family environment.Amazon.com was kind enough to provide this product for me through their Vine Program for reviewing and I was not request to provide a positive review. Opinions expressed here are my own."

column2: "Got this one
column3: and the grasshopper .. this didn't do a thing .. the grasshopper after of a couple days in my sunniest window where all my solar toys are started moving (get that one) .. about 10 days later
column4: still nothing .. so delicate don't even buy like it's a matchbox .."

column2: "This is a great game for any age! We have played many games now! I can see a little wear in the dice
column3: the pictures are flat on the dice rather than in-dented like normal dice. The score card unfolds to make a larger one. Everything fits inside the "?" box when finished playing."

column2: "This was a Christmas gift for my 18mo. old daugher and she loves it.  It's a bit tricky and difficult to put together but with a bit of upper body strength and some determination you can accomplish it.  I love that it's sturdy
column3: so when my daughter stands in it I don't have to worry about her toppling over."

column2: "My boys 10
column4: 7 & 4 love building with zoobs. The toys themselves are are very sturdy... the case however is cheap. It broke within hours. We also overpaid by $30. :( I see they are $55 now... much better price. Either way they are a great toy
column5: with hours of fun!"

column2: "My sons were excited when they started playing with the Spiderman Stunt Buggy.  They discovered the magnetic part in the back that could hold spiderman.  Then they discovered that it could flip and spent a whole afternoon playing with it. Unfortunately by the next day the flip mechanism stopped working
column3: it's the most fun part of the buggy you think the manufacturers would make it more durable.  Piece of junk!"

column2: "These wooden toys are perfect for my day care kids.  The quality is good.  Love the look of the toy"
"My daughter received these for her birthday
column3: along with the castle. Both of my daughters love playing with the set and have a great time pretending they are princesses too.The only problem I have found is that two of the princesses have split personalities. Snow White seems to think she is both Snow White and Jasmine. Rapunzel seems to think she is Rapunzel and Ariel. Now
column4: since we have Ariel
column5: my daughter asked if it is okay that Rapunzel also thinks that she is Ariel. I asked and Ariel doesn't seem to mind. However
column6: since we don't have Jasmine
column7: I think Snow White is safe from ridicule for the time being!"

column2: "We got this for our 5yr old grandson to carry his Leapster GS in for Christmas. We really like it. He is not a gentle little fellow and we have not had any problems with it. It nicely carries his 2 game cartridges inside and he loves to take it with us when wego out in the car or to something that would be boring for him."

"I bought this toy for my daughters 3rd birthday and it is in the bathtub everytime she takes a bath and she shows no interest in it what so ever. the boots character i threw away due to mold and my daughter hasn't even noticed. I don't recall a tree being attached to it i'll have to look again. I am thinking about actually taking this to the pool to see if she will play with it there."

"Our girls love this!!  They are 2 and 4 and love this camera. They were constantly getting mine out of my purse and I said no more!  I found this one and bought it based on reviews and we are very happy. They really enjoy taking pictures. And they like the little add ons you can add to pictures. Super cute!!"
"The TRIO Hot Wheels Stunt Ramp Builder set is super cool.  The TRIO blocks are easy to build with
column3: they just snap together and stick in place.  While this set starts at ages 3 and up
column4: I will say it does take an adult to help build the sets but kids can of course play around with snapping the pieces together.  There are different configurations you can build which make for more fun it gives you lots of options!Once the set was built it stayed up pretty well.  I was able to pick it up and move it around without it coming apart.  Now of course if you don't handle it properly the pieces will come apart
column5: but it just add to the fun by rebuilding it.  It is the perfect size for kids and my boys (3 and 4) really got a kick out of it.  They now want more of the TRIO blocks to play with and I even found that there are other TRIO Hot Wheels sets you can add in.  You do get a green Hot Wheels car that you build with the TRIO blocks but my boys also include their other regular Hot Wheels cars.Overall
column6: this set is great for any Hot Wheels fan.  You get the fun of not only building your stunt sets but then by playing with it.  You get tons of pieces and the instructions show clear pictures of how to build the sets."

column2: "this price on this doll was right ($17) my daughter wanted lalaloopsy stuff for Christmas and when i saw this i had to get it. my daughter loved it. She has played with it everyday since Christmas. this is the real thing not a mini or a plush. Great buy"
"Since my 8 year old grand daughter loves the Warriors series
column3: I was glad to see this Cats Toob available on Amazon  (couldn't find it in stores).  She figured out which ones look like the cats in the books.  Maybe she'll give the others names worthy of a Warriors cat and write her own story for them."

column2: "Mattel's Movie Masters Batman has a great amount of detail to him. His sculpt is great
column3: his paint is pretty good
column4: and his articulation is really good.Batman's sculpt is based off his appearance in The Dark Knight and The Dark Knight Rises. This design has become my favorite of the Batman designs
column5: and the mold does an excellent job recapturing it. The one thing I don't like about it is that the cape is made of a pretty sturdy plastic
column6: which gets in the way of his posing.He has a really nice paint job
column7: at least for what it's supposed to be. Obviously
column8: his suit is almost completely black
column9: so you're not going to see a whole lot of coloring. However
column10: Mattel went the extra mile and gave him multiple shades of black
column11: so it doesn't look boring. The only thing I would have changed paint-wise is that his pupils are a solid black. This is the only thing that makes it seem like a bigger version of their 3 3/4" action figures. I think it would have been better if they had eye color to them.His articulation is very good. He is able to move pretty much everywhere. As I already stated
column12: the only problem is the fact that his cape gets in the way of posing him.The only other problem I have with him is his accessories
column13: or rather his lacking of them. As an adult collectible
column14: you would think he would feature a lot of cool things to display him with. Sadly
column15: this is not the case. The only thing he comes with is a stand for the build-a-batsignal feature. This entire system feels gimmicky and childish for an adult collector's toy line.Though it's not perfect
column16: the Movie Masters Batman is probably the best plastic depiction of the film incarnation of the character yet. I recommend this to any collector who loves watching the Dark Knight trilogy."

column2: "Made out of heavy duty plastic
column3: this set includes a Large Smurf house
column4: which was very easy to assemble
column5: a small Gargamel figure and the smurfs
column6: including Papa and Smurfette. I only wish Gargamel was larger than the Smurfs
column7: more true to form."

column2: "This toy is very fun for spatially inclined people and mathematicallycurious people. The Soma Cube idea is far more difficult than pentominosbecause of 3-Dimensional irregular shapes. I know for me
column3: with many ofthese challenges I am almost close but am one block off-target. Nevertheless
column4: it is still a good solitary brain teaser since regardless of spatial abilityit does improve spatial perception."

column2: "My wife and I were looking for a relatively simple (and portable) game we could take with us on overnight trips to visit family and on vacations.  So
column3: we decided to give “Square Shooters The first deck of cards on dice” a try.  My wife played the game with oou eight year old son.  Below are her comments:This is a terrific new idea for avid card players.  If you are ready for something different
column4: there are plenty of variations to keep you busy with this card/dice set.  Recommended ages are 8 and up
column5: but I think it’s only appropriate at that age if your child is already familiar with card games like rummy.  But I would put this on the “great gift” list for ages 10 and up.  Four stars."

column2: "This is a cute little doll that is sturdy. She is kind of funny with her huge head and tiny body.It says the doll is for 5+yr olds. This must be for the use of the computer and the tiny shoes. Mine will be played with by a 2.5yr old and she is fine with not putting things in her mouth.I went online and checked out the activities and they are educational. You choose your doll
column3: only one. You can play games and there are lessons on playing nice and recycling items
column4: things like that. I played one game on the easy level with the musical notes...lol a 5 yr old could probably do better than I did. There are little video's to watch also. Very child friendly but it does require going online
column5: without that it is just a little doll.My biggest disappointment is that Makayla Song doll loves music and plays the guitar. You only get the cardboard one that is part of the package. I think they could have included a little plastic guitar maybe instead of the charm.Over all it is cute and it has the bonus of some good morals taught online about living in our world being nice to it and to each other."

column2: "Truth be Told is an excellent party game.  The game encourages good conversations. Truth be Told is best played with good friends and is a fun way to get to known your friends even better.On your turn you write down your answer to the question asked. At the same time the other players write down what they think your answer will be. The other players could write down serous or funny answers. You than collect all of the cards and read them aloud
column3: including yours. The other players than guess the answer they think is your answer. Points are award to anyone who had their question picked as the correct answer.I recommend Truth be Told to anyone looking for a fun new party game."

column2: "I'm putting the Alphabet Puzzle up for future use.  Granddaughter is only two years old and too young for this puzzle"
"love hex bugs! These things are entertaining to watch go through the obsticle course. Price is great and ships fast"
"As usual
column3: Eeboo does a wonderful job with this game.  The pictures are fantastic - a work of art.  The pieces are thick and durable.  It's appealing and inviting.  We also have the Hasbro "Original Memory Game
column4: which has SEVENTY tiny cards with treacly, goofy cartoons on them, and I find it incredibly annoying.  The Life on Earth memory game is light years better - creative, artistic, thicker pieces, just much nicer overall.  Worth a few dollars more.

column2: "My grandson could not wait to get his train set up and going (which did not take long at all). He played with it for hrs. Arrived quickly and packaged well."
"This is a nice puzzle that offers can occupy a child for a while
column3: provided a child has enough patience
column4: or serve as a quick child-parent game.  Puzzle pieces are made of thick plastic
column5: they fit snugly
column6: and the completed puzzle is sturdy.  The puzzle comes with a display stand.  The puzzle is about as challenging as a LEGO set
column7: because both provide instructions on what to do.My 4 1/2 year old son and I put this puzzle together in about 30 minutes.  In the beginning I was sorting pieces and he was assembling the puzzle.  All pieces are numbered and have directional arrows showing where the next piece goes.  It was pretty easy for my son to assemble to piece #100
column8: at which point he started looking for piece #200 because he only knew how to count in hundreds past 100.  So
column9: I explained to him that after 100 comes 101
column10: which I thought to be a nice teaching moment.By this point
column11: I have already sorted all pieces and arranged them in groups of ten.  I began assembling the puzzle beginning with the piece #130 and up.  When my son installed piece #129
column12: we joined the part he was assembling with the part that was assembled by me and then quickly finished the remaining 20 or so pieces.The result was a pretty colorful and sturdy ball showing a picture of the NY Times Square at night."

column2: "My kids love this thing but I hate it. When it works it works great but when it clogs or jams I just want to toss it out the window. We take this thing apart (the gear section) regularly to get out clogged playdoh or unstick jammed gears. I think this toy was a great concept/idea with exceptional potential but the execution of the gear section is just terrible.  Great fun (when it works) for kids but a total frustration for parents. If you get this make sure you keep your screwdriver handy at all times....you will need it."
"It broke down in the very first use. Just putting the batteries. I could not connect it. This is a waste of money."
"I was a bit skeptical about this puzzle
column3: namely how sturdy it was going to be
column4: and how easily the structure would hold its shape.  That said
column5: the Puzzleball was fun to put together
column6: and holds up really well.  The pieces are hard plastic
column7: and generally fit quite well with each other.  The ball holds its shape nicely while you build it
column8: although putting the last pieces in (the north or south pole
column9: depending on how you started) is a bit trickier
column10: since you can only push from the inside.  You can build it two ways.  The easier way is by using the numbers on the back of each piece
column11: and the harder way is by visually fitting the pieces
column12: like any normal puzzle.  Due to the 3D nature and abundance of blue pieces
column13: this second method is more of a challenge
column14: especially for younger puzzlers.  The globe comes with two display stands- the rotating arm shown on the box
column15: or a simpler saucer-type stand to allow picking up
column16: etc.  The maps is full of fun little details and while is hardly cartographer-grade material
